practice_problems: For what value(s) of $k$, if any, is the function $f(x) = \begin{cases} 2x^2 - k & \text{if } x < 2 \\ x + k & \text{if } x \ge 2 \end{cases}$ continuous on $(-\infty, \infty)$?

A particle moves along the x-axis so that at any time $t \ge 0$, its velocity is given by $v(t) = 4t$. If the position of the particle at time $t = 4$ is $x(4) = 8$, what is the particle’s position at time $t=0$?
Given $f(x) = \frac{4x^2 - 3}{x^2 + 1}$, for what values of $x$ is the graph of $f$ concave downwards?
Let $f$ be defined by $f(x) = 6 - x$ for all real numbers $x$. For what values of $x$ is the function increasing?
Find an equation for the line tangent to the graph of $f(x) = 7x - 1$ at the point where $x=6$.
What is the equation of the line tangent to the curve $y = x^3 - 2x^2$ at the point $(2, 0)$?

A particle moves along the x-axis so that its velocity at any time $t \ge 0$ is given by $v(t) = 4t^3 - 4t$. Which of the following expressions could represent the position $x(t)$ of the particle at any time $t \ge 0$?
What is the slope of the tangent line to $x^2 + 2xy + 3y^2 = 22$ that lies in the first quadrant at the point where $y=1$?
